author: Società Athesis S.p.A.
title: Si diffondono le keybox anche a Verona: cosa sono e perché fanno discutere
text:
Un codice suggerito al telefono o sbloccato direttamente da remoto e il forziere si apre, dando accesso a camere ed appartamenti del centro e dei quartieri a ridosso dell’ansa dell’Adige. Anche in città, sono sempre di più le locazioni turistiche che si appoggiano alle keybox: piccole scatoline di sicurezza che contengono le chiavi degli appartamenti ad uso turistico.
Il fenomeno delle keybox
Se in altre città il fenomeno sta facendo storcere il naso ad amministratori e residenti, in riva all’Adige la questione almeno fino ad ora sembra però essere passata inosservata, complice il fatto che si tratta per lo più di piccoli rettangoli affissi sulle facciate dei palazzi.
Ed è invece molto poco diffusa, anche se presente, l’abitudine di assicurare queste keybox anche su spazi pubblici, plateatici, pali e ringhiere. Accade così, invece, a Milano dove le scatoline si trovano affisse un po’ dappertutto, anche sugli arredi pubblici dalle ringhiere sui Navigli a Porta Garibaldi. Una situazione che il presidente della commissione sicurezza e coesione sociale del Comune lombardo punta ad arginare perché, sostiene, «rea di impattare sul decoro urbano». In altre città, c’è chi ha già preso misure in tal senso: a Parigi e in altre città francesi sono vietate, a New York il rischio è di incorrere in multe e sanzioni e a Venezia la Soprintendenza ne chiede la messa al bando.
Ad oggi, a Verona nulla di tutto ciò, anche se le keybox sono diffuse e molto utilizzate dai locatori turistici. A ben osservare, infatti, in centro si vedono. Ce ne sono parecchie concentrate, ad esempio, in appena due civici in via Cattaneo a pochi passi dalla Bra. Le cassettine sono state affisse sulla facciata dei palazzi, accanto ai portoni o ai campanelli. Analoga immagine in via Oberdan, dove la chiave in questione è una card, una chiave elettrica, e anche in via San Nicolò: qui le keybox trovano posto su una griglia di fronte al palazzo con le locazioni turistiche.
A Verona, però, stanno diventando ancor più diffuse le tastiere con codice numerico per sbloccare le porte direttamente da remoto, da cellulare.
Leggi anche
[Protesta in tonaca contro la ztl h24: «Il centro diventa un cimitero». Ma c'è chi si dissocia: «Strumentalizzati»]
Cosa dicono i locatori turistici
«Di certo non è una scatoletta che impatta o mette in discussione il degrado urbano», tiene a sottolineare Edoardo Nestori, presidente dell’associazione Locatori turistici del Veneto. «Sono sistemi utilizzati specialmente all’arrivo perché non è obbligatoria la presenza dell’host. Ne abbiamo in centro storico, talvolta nemmeno affisse ai palazzi ma nei dintorni. È comprensibile che chi si trova a gestire molte locazioni turistiche e non ha uno staff per i check in utilizzi questi strumenti. Le versioni più moderne sono tastiere numeriche che, digitato il codice, aprono il portone», analizza Stefano Napolitano, locatore turistico e consigliere della prima circoscrizione.
«È una sorta di cassetta di sicurezza, tra l’altro posizionata appena fuori la porta e in un posto che non sia invasivo e ovviamente previa autorizzazione del condominio. Non viene utilizzata sempre, ma in caso di arrivi di notte è molto utile», analizza Marco Massari che in centro storico gestisce circa 25 appartamenti ad affitto breve–turistico.
«A livello di controllo, il tastierino apriporta con la possibilità di cambiare il codice da remoto è il migliore di tutti: si può modificare il pin a ogni ingresso mentre il mazzo di chiavi, potenzialmente, potrebbe essere doppiato. Non è mai accaduto, ma il rischio c’è», aggiunge Massari. E sul fronte sicurezza su chi effettivamente entra in casa? «Codice porta o accesso alla keybox vengono comunque rilasciati dopo procedure di sicurezza online molto dettagliate con registrazione dei documenti e la verifica che chi entra sia effettivamente chi è registrato», conclude Massari.

author: Chapin Jewell News & Tribune Correspondent
title: Keyser falls at Petersburg, takes Fort Hill to the edge
text:
CUMBERLAND, MD. (WV News) – After suffering a disappointing, 19-point, 82-63 loss at Petersburg on Tuesday, the Keyser Golden Tornado rallied at Fort Hill on Wednesday, taking the No. 1 ranked Sentinels to the brink before falling in a four-point, 63-59 loss.
Despite the loss, the showing at Fort Hill was a very good one. But first, a word about the Petersburg loss for Keyser.
Petersburg jumped up on Keyser early, and by the time the Black and Gold started to see better results, it was too little, too late.
The host Vikings led the visiting Tornado 22-13 at the end of one period, and 46-26 at the half. Keyser edged Petersburg 19-17 in the third frame but still trailed 63-45 entering the game’s fourth period. There, Petersburg’s 19-18 edge kept Keyser at arms-length in the Vikings’ 82-63 victory.
Petersburg was led in double figures by the trio of Caden Ours, Peyton Tingler, and Trace Rohrbuagh. Ours tallied 21, Tingler 19, and Rohrbaugh 18 in the win. Additionally, Caden Arbaugh posted four points, and Jack Boddy and Lucas Riggleman two points each.
In the loss, Patrick Liller and Drew Matlick teamed to lead Keyser with 10 points each. Next was Jace Courrier and Grayson Lamka with nine points apiece, Kam Samples with eight points, Evan Ack with seven points, and Layton Valentine and Jack Stanislawczyk three points each. Finally, Damarian Allen posted two points, and Chase Davis and Ian Spiker one point apiece. 11 Tornado players scored.
Poor shooting at the free throw line doomed Keyser. The Golden Tornado went only 13 of 29 from the charity stripe in the loss.
“We lost by 19, and Petersburg shot disgustingly well. But, we missed 16 free throws. We’ve talked about the free throw aspect, and of course, the careless turnovers,” Keyser coach Scott Furey stated.
Then came the Fort Hill game, one in which most observers would be won big by the Sentinels. But Keyser had other thoughts, turning in what likely was their best performance of the year, despite the four-point, 63-59 loss.
Ironically, things didn’t start the greatest for Keyser as Fort Hill nearly doubled up the Tornado 19-10 in the game’s first period. Deshaun Brown led the Sentinels with 13 points in the opener. Keyser was led by Jace Courrier with six points.
In the second period, Keyser came alive, outscoring Fort Hill 19-9 to take a one-point, 29-28 lead at the half. Patrick Liller and Kam Samples led Keyser with five points each in the second stanza. Fort Hill was led by Jabril Daniels with five points.
Keyser continued to play well into the third frame, but Fort Hill’s response to being down at the half was to outscore Keyser 20-15 to regain the lead entering the game’s fourth period, 48-44. Daniels and Brown again led Fort Hill with six points each. Samples led the Black and Gold with six points.
The fourth and final period represented a continued tough battle between the two squads, with each scoring 15 points apiece. As such, Fort Hill would ultimately hold their four-point lead in the 63-59 victory. Brown posted eight points for the Sentinels in the final frame. Chase Davis scored 10 points for Keyser in the lid closer.
“The effort was there, and honestly, execution was there at times. There were just some crucial turnovers, and going eight for 16 from the line, and one for five in the fourth quarter, didn’t help us as well,” Furey stated.
What went well?
“I think defensively, we were able to execute what we wanted to do. We didn’t want to let them just dribble-drive all over the place. We forced them into jump shots. Deshaun hit a bunch early, he had 13 in the first quarter. That kind of got them going, but, for the most part, our biggest thing was making sure we rebounded the basketball. For the most part, we rebounded the ball really well,” Furey detailed.
What didn’t go well?
“We turned the ball over 20 times, and we really didn’t get pressed or forced. A lot of them were unforced and live-ball turnovers that turned into layups. Therein lies your real issue. Unfortunately, that’s two games in a row, we had the same thing last night against Petersburg,” Furey explained.
Fort Hill was led overall by Deshaun Brown with a game-high 27 points. Also in double figures for the Sentinels was Jabril Daniels with 15 points, and Gavin Carney with 11 points. Gamil Daniels and Steven Spencer each scored five points apiece.
In the loss, Keyser was led overall in double figures by Kam Samples with 12 points, Grayson Lambka with 11 points, and Chase Davis with 10 points. Next was Jace Courrier and Jack Stanislawczyk with six points apiece, Patrick Liller and Evan Ack with five points each, and Drew Matlick with four points.
“Kam has the confidence. He plays a ton of basketball all year. Not necessarily the travel stuff, but he’s at the playground all summer long. He has confidence about being able to play and his abilities. He’s starting to come into his own, and I think he’s really starting to understand what his role is for us,” Furey stated.
Keyser (5-9) will next look to rebound at home against Allegany on Friday, Feb. 2 at 7:30 p.m.
“Everybody knows that we’re not a bad basketball team, on our team. But whenever you look up and you’re so close, and so close, and so close. I tell them all the time, put that on me, the coach lost the game, we got outcoached, whatever, put that on me. But, the thing is, they are so ready to crack through that and get that statement win,” Furey explained.
According to Furey, “Winning here would have been a huge thing. Now we’ve got Allegany coming in Friday, and so it doesn’t get any easier, and then Southern Monday. It’s a gauntlet, Murderer’s Row type deal for us, but, I told them, we have to play a stretch like this if we’re going to get to where we’re going to get.”

author: 張岩
title: 印尼沉船事故已確認4人遇難23人獲救　仍有38人失蹤 - 國際 - 香港文匯網
text:
印度尼西亞東爪哇省搜救部門3日對記者說，當天凌晨在巴厘海峽發生的沉船事故已造成4人遇難，目前有23人獲救，仍有38人失蹤。
印尼沉船事故發生後，有乘客家屬痛哭。（美聯社） 據新華社報道，印度尼西亞東爪哇省搜救部門3日對記者說，當天凌晨在巴厘海峽發生的沉船事故已造成4人遇難，目前有23人獲救，仍有38人失蹤。
據印尼巴厘島和東爪哇省搜救部門消息，沉船事故發生於當地時間3日零時19分，事發渡輪為「圖努·普拉塔馬·賈亞」號，從東爪哇省的吉打邦港出發，原計劃駛往巴厘島的吉利馬努克港。該渡輪共載有65人，包括53名乘客與12名船員，並運載22輛車輛，其中包括14輛大型卡車。
搜救部門說，零時16分，該渡輪通過海事無綫電頻道發出緊急求救信號，報告船艙進水，出現引擎故障。3分鐘後，渡輪電力系統完全熄火。零時22分許，附近船隻發現該船已經傾覆。
搜救人員表示，搜救工作正在展開，搜救期間巴厘海峽浪高約達2.5米，給搜救行動造成困難。目前，事故原因仍在調查中。
中國駐登巴薩總領館3日表示，經初步了解，在印尼沉船事故中沒有中國公民。
責任編輯： 張岩
topics: Disaster and Accident->transportation accident and incident

author: Michał Rogucki
title: Innovative Robotic Model by MIT Engineers Mimics the Human Heart
text:
Innovative Robotic Model by MIT Engineers Mimics the Human Heart
Summary: Researchers at MIT have introduced a groundbreaking robotic right ventricle that imitates the human heart’s function. This advanced model employs hybrid technology featuring actual heart tissue and artificial balloon-like muscles for biomedical applications.
MIT engineers have pioneered a replica of the human right ventricle, creating a lifelike robotic model to help understand and treat cardiac disorders better. The bio-robotic apparatus simulates the heart’s pumping action using a combination of genuine heart tissue and actuating synthetic muscles. This unique combination permits precise control over the artificial ventricle, allowing the study of the natural structures like valves within the heart more closely.
The model is exceptionally versatile, able to imitate healthy and various pathological conditions of the right ventricle such as right ventricular dysfunction leading to conditions like pulmonary hypertension and heart attacks. Additionally, this right ventricle simulator provides a practical testing environment for new heart devices and potentially offers strategies to prevent heart failure, especially in high-risk ICU patients.
By addressing the challenges posed by the intricate structure and mechanics of the right ventricle, which current diagnostic tools struggle to assess, this MIT innovation stands out. It intricately captures the anatomical complexities, and through the use of soft robotics, recreates the delicate pumping motion of the heart’s muscle.
The robotic model’s testing results have already shown encouraging outcomes, including the replication of real heart rhythm and the ability to adjust contractions to emulate various cardiac conditions. This introduces the prospect of better diagnosing and treatment for heart conditions.
Furthermore, the model has demonstrated significant potential in testing and improving cardiac devices. Surgeons and cardiologists could refine surgical techniques on the robotic model, enhancing patient safety and outcomes during actual procedures. With aspirations to extend the robotic heart’s functioning to consistent long-term use, researchers are optimistic about its future applications, including fully tunable artificial hearts for transplant purposes.
FAQ Section Based on the Article:
1. What has been developed by researchers at MIT?
Researchers at MIT have developed a groundbreaking robotic right ventricle that imitates the function of the human heart, incorporating actual heart tissue and artificial balloon-like muscles.
2. How does the robotic right ventricle work?
The robotic right ventricle works by simulating the heart’s pumping action using a combination of genuine heart tissue and actuating synthetic muscles, which allows for precise control over the model.
3. What are the potential benefits of this robotic right ventricle?
The potential benefits include better understanding and treatment of cardiac disorders, a practical environment to test new heart devices, and strategies to prevent heart failure, particularly in ICU patients.
4. What challenges in cardiac research does this innovation address?
It addresses challenges in assessing the intricate structure and mechanics of the right ventricle, which are difficult to measure accurately with current diagnostic tools.
5. Can the model simulate various cardiac conditions?
Yes, the model can imitate both healthy and pathological conditions of the right ventricle, such as dysfunction leading to conditions like pulmonary hypertension and heart attacks.
6. How can the robotic model assist surgeons and cardiologists?
Surgeons and cardiologists can use the robotic model to refine their surgical techniques, enhancing patient safety and outcomes during actual cardiac procedures.
7. What future applications do researchers anticipate for this robotic heart?
Future applications could include consistent long-term use of the robotic heart and the development of fully tunable artificial hearts for transplant purposes.
Definitions and Key Terms:
– Robotic Right Ventricle: A robotic model that replicates the function of the right ventricle of the human heart, used for studying heart conditions and testing biomedical applications.
– Hybrid Technology: A combination of biological materials, such as heart tissue, with artificial components like balloon-like muscles.
– Soft Robotics: A subfield of robotics that deals with constructing robots from highly flexible materials, which can replicate movements like those of living organisms.
– Pulmonary Hypertension: A type of high blood pressure that affects the arteries in the lungs and the right side of the heart.
– ICU: Intensive Care Unit, a special department of a hospital that provides intensive care medicine.
Related Links:
– For information about MIT and their other research initiatives, visit
MIT.

Michał Rogucki is a pioneering figure in the field of renewable energy, particularly known for his work on solar power innovations. His research and development efforts have significantly advanced solar panel efficiency and sustainability. Rogucki’s commitment to green energy solutions is also evident in his advocacy for integrating renewable sources into national power grids. His groundbreaking work not only contributes to the scientific community but also plays a crucial role in promoting environmental sustainability and energy independence. Rogucki’s influence extends beyond academia, impacting industry practices and public policy regarding renewable energy.
